title: Deere Workers Approve New Contract, Ending Strike
summary: Members of United Auto Workers returning to work with raises, bonuses. Workers at Deere & Co. ratified a new six-year contract Wednesday, ending a strike against the farm and construction machinery company that lasted over a month.

title: Two Men Convicted in Killing of Malcolm X Expected to Be Exonerated
summary: Muhammad A. Aziz and Khalil Islam spent years behind bars until a Netflix documentary sparked a review by the district attorney. The Manhattan district attorney's office on Thursday plans to ask a New York state judge to toss the convictions of two men found guilty of the 1965 assassination of Malcolm X.

title: Rapper Young Dolph Killed in Memphis
summary: Musician fatally shot at Makeda's Homemade Butter Cookies. Rapper Young Dolph was shot and killed in Memphis Wednesday. He was 36 years old.

title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee at the Fed
summary: Powell and Brainard have both presided over the inflation breakout.. President Biden says he'll announce his choice to lead the Federal Reserve for the next four years by the end of this week, and the leading candidates are current Chairman Jerome Powell and governor Lael Brainard. This reminds us of Hillary Clinton's famous formulation in response to the Benghazi debacle: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

title: Tesla, Toyota Accuse Biden's EV Tax Credit of Putting Unions Over the Environment
summary: Consumers get full credit only if they buy union-built cars; White House says it wants to save middle-class jobs and the planet. WASHINGTON-President Biden says he wants to save the planet and save union jobs. The electric-vehicle tax credit in his social spending package shows how those aims can sometimes conflict.

title: Sony's PlayStation and Others Put Pressure on Activision Blizzard
summary: Head of Sony gaming console unit told employees the company asked videogame giant how it will address article about CEO's handling of sexual-misconduct accusations. Sony Group Corp.'s PlayStation unit has asked Activision Blizzard Inc. to explain how it plans to address a Wall Street Journal article about its chief executive's handling of sexual misconduct issues.

title: 'Rust' Crew Member Alleges Baldwin Was Reckless, Safety Rules Ignored
summary: A lawsuit filed by 911 caller on film set says Mr. Baldwin should not have discharged gun because rehearsed scene didn't call for it. A "Rust" movie crew member who frantically called 911 after a fatal shooting on the film's New Mexico set last month said producers ignored safety protocols and that star Alec Baldwin acted recklessly before discharging a live round that killed the film's cinematographer and wounded the director.

title: House Bill to Improve Judges' Financial Disclosures Progresses
summary: Judiciary Committee quickly passes legislation in wake of WSJ articles. WASHINGTON-The House Judiciary Committee passed bipartisan legislation on Wednesday to require federal judges to report more promptly their financial holdings and stock trades, sending the bill to the U.S. House floor less than a month after it was introduced.

title: U.S. Climate Risk Guidance Will Be in Line With Global Principles, Bank Regulator Says
summary: The acting head of the U.S.'s top banking regulator called for climate risk to be included in stress tests and spoke about guidance his agency plans to release. The acting head of the U.S.'s top banking regulator called for banks to be screened for climate risk as part of their periodic stress tests and said the agency's own regulatory approach was focused on maintaining the safety and soundness of the financial system.

title: Biden's Gas-Price Diversion
summary: He sends out the FTC posse to chase the wrong suspects.. President Biden is feeling political pressure to show that he's doing something about rising energy costs even as his Administration's policies are a big part of the problem. Ergo, round up the usual fossil-fuel suspects.

title: Has Tony Evers Learned His Lesson?
summary: Wisconsin's Governor deploys 500 National Guard troops ahead of the Rittenhouse verdict.. Prosecutors say Kyle Rittenhouse's conduct at a riot in Kenosha, Wis., on Aug. 25, 2020 was "criminally reckless," and we'll soon find out whether jurors agree. But no jury is needed to decide whether it was morally and politically reckless for public officials and the press to condone vicious rioting in Kenosha and other cities last summer. That created the vacuum in which the Rittenhouse shootings took place.

title: Nvidia Posts Record Revenue as Videogaming Sales Soar
summary: Revenue reached $7.1 billion despite continuing chip shortage. Graphics-chip company Nvidia Corp. posted another quarter of record sales amid supercharged demand for videogaming and data centers.

title: 'Woke' Is a Bad Word for a Real Threat to American Democracy
summary: In authoritarian regimes, vengeance and coercion stand in place of justice and reason. I've seen it before.. The search is on for new words for old ideas. "Cancel culture" and "woke" have become overused and abused, part of a struggle to define one's political opponents in the harshest possible way, to dismiss ideas as not only wrong or harmful, but intolerable.

title: The Decline of Congress
summary: A brawl over a cartoon tweet sums up the current House of Representatives.. Congress has a public approval rating of 22%, which makes us wonder what the 22% are watching. It can't be C-SPAN. If they paid attention to this week's spectacle involving Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar, the 22% are likely to join the other 78%.

title: Maloney's Midterm Messaging Mistake
summary: The Democrats' problem isn't bad salesmanship. It's what they're selling.. Poor Sean Patrick Maloney. He represents an upstate New York district and chairs the Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee. Between a strong GOP showing in New Jersey and election losses in Virginia, he had a rough November-and things will get a lot worse next year, as Republicans will almost certainly take the House.

title: Joe Biden's Trumpian Excess
summary: The Trump fixation has produced policies that are turning off American voters.. The hardest thing to believe about Joe Biden is that his presidency is less than a year old. It feels like forever.

title: Notable & Quotable: The Search for Truth
summary: 'A kind of funny pattern has emerged as it relates to liberal acceptance of inconvenient facts.'. A Nov. 10 Twitter thread from lawyer and podcast host Ben Yelin:

title: 'Collapse' Review: The Shock of Reform
summary: The rush of intellectual and creative freedom couldn't be contained, but gratitude turned into anger as the Soviet economy faltered.. When the Soviet Union fell apart three decades ago, Western leaders were at first deeply worried about the sudden disintegration of a vast, nuclear-armed state, foreseeing new threats and dangers. Soon enough, they came to understand the collapse in a different way-as the triumph of liberal values over dictatorship. For Vladimir Putin, by contrast, it was "the greatest geopolitical catastrophe of the century." At least no one disputes its momentous significance.

title: Local Radio Helped Make Me at Home in Texas
summary: In the streaming age, local stations are an underappreciated part of a community.. Austin, Texas

title: 'Space Armageddon' and Putin's Threats to Ukraine
summary: Russia's ruler senses weakness in the U.S. military's reliance on satellites.. Russia successfully conducted a test in which a direct-ascent missile destroyed a nearly 40-year-old defunct Soviet spy satellite, U.S. Space Command announced Monday. This unsettling development is noteworthy because it coincides with Russia's massive military buildup along the Ukrainian border. Moscow's pre-positioning of more than 100,000 soldiers, tanks and heavy weaponry has spurred the Pentagon's concerns about a possible Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Biden Asks FTC to Examine Whether Oil, Gas Companies Are Inflating Gas Prices
summary: President cites 'mounting evidence of anti-consumer behavior' by oil-and-gas companies. WASHINGTON-President Biden called on the Federal Trade Commission to investigate whether oil-and-gas companies are participating in illegal conduct aimed at keeping gasoline prices high, in the latest effort by the White House to respond to public concerns about costs for everything from fuel to groceries.

title: House Votes to Censure GOP Rep. Paul Gosar Over Violent Video
summary: Democrats also removed Arizona congressman from committee assignments. WASHINGTON-The Democrat-controlled House voted 223-207 Wednesday to censure GOP Rep. Paul Gosar and remove him from his committee assignments over an animated video he posted last week that showed him killing Democratic Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and poised to attack President Biden.

title: The World's Richest Athletes Earn the Cash to Buy Average-Priced Homes in Hours
summary: Sports stars from Lionel Messi to LeBron James don't even have to put in a full-time week to afford new digs. This year, Lionel Messi, arguably the greatest soccer player of all time, left his former club F.C. Barcelona for Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Holiday Gift Books 2021: Business
summary: A collection of books that offer insight and guidance for negotiating the work-life balance and resetting for a post-pandemic career.. We are a nation of workaholics. Americans work, on average, more hours than our counterparts in any peer nation, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development. The Covid-19 crisis only deepened our obsession with productivity. In 2020, employee engagement rates hit record highs as workers doubled down on their jobs to fend off layoffs, financial uncertainty and social isolation.

title: Holiday Gift Books 2021: Sports
summary: A set of new books chronicle a legendary basketball team-and even a fan for its rivals finds much to love.. On April 18, 1969, the dynastic Boston Celtics, featuring Bill Russell in the twilight of his career and John Havlicek in the prime of his, led the New York Knickerbockers in the NBA Eastern Conference Finals, three games to two. I was 15 years old and the Knicks were my passion. Game Six was held at Boston Garden, famous for its parquet floor and for a bald man named Red Auerbach perched in a courtside seat, victory cigar at the ready. I watched the game on the portable black-and-white TV in my bedroom.

title: Holiday Gift Books 2021: Children's Books
summary: Sumptuous illustrated classics, beguiling box sets and more books that make thrilling presents and engrossing reading.. Why give a child the gift of a single book when, without using much more wrapping paper, you could give a collection, an anthology or a series? Herewith, some ideas.

title: Holiday Gift Books 2021: Nature
summary: Gifts to take readers into the wild-from the comfort of a cozy chair.. Anyone can declaim the glories of waterfalls or snowy mountain peaks, but who dares speak for the swamp? Edward Struzik, in his adventurous natural history "Swamplands: Tundra Beavers, Quaking Bogs and the Improbable World of Peat," fills his travelogue through that sodden landscape with accounts of the dread it has inspired in humankind. "One felt like taking a dose of quinine every time one looked at it," shuddered an art critic upon seeing a mere painting of a misty wetland. "If ugliness is real beauty they have yet to prove it to a very large mass of the assembled public."

title: Apollo Poised for Big Returns on Hertz Stock Buyback
summary: Hertz will sell debt to redeem preferred stock held by Apollo Global Management. Apollo Global Management Inc. is poised to mint a big return on a less-than-five-month investment in Hertz Global Holdings Inc.'s turnaround after the rental-car company said it would incur new debt to redeem preferred shares issued when it exited chapter 11.

summary: Resume Subscription. A group of internet friends decided last week to bid on the last privately held original copy of the U.S. Constitution, a mission with all the hallmarks of the cryptocurrency world they sprang from.

U.K. credit cards because of their high fees, a move that marks a major escalation in the retail giant's yearslong battle with the card network.

title: SEC Investigating Developer of Experimental Alzheimer's Drug
summary: Resume Subscription. The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating claims that Cassava Sciences Inc., the sixth-best performing U.S. stock this year, manipulated research results of its experimental Alzheimer's drug, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Lawsuit Filed Against Travis Scott, Drake, Others in Astroworld Tragedy
summary: Lawsuit on behalf of 125 festivalgoers says musicians, companies failed to create safe conditions. A lawsuit filed on behalf of 125 Astroworld attendees seeks $750 million in punitive damages from musicians Travis Scott and Drake, as well as corporations involved in the festival.

title: Rittenhouse Defense Makes New Move for a Mistrial
summary: Attorneys say they received a compressed copy of a key video from the prosecution. Lawyers for Kyle Rittenhouse, the teenager who shot and killed two people during unrest in Kenosha, Wis., last year, have made a new motion for a mistrial over a video they say was transferred to them by the prosecution at a lower resolution than what was available to the state.

title: Entrepreneur Rocketed Into Space, Then Died a Month Later
summary: Glen de Vries, a charismatic leader who co-founded a medical-software firm, found time to master the guitar, learn to fly and teach himself Japanese.

title: Drug Overdose Deaths Hit Record High in U.S.
summary: Nation records more than 100,000 fatalities over 12 months for first time. The U.S. recorded its highest number of drug-overdose deaths in a 12-month period, surpassing 100,000 for the first time in the shadow of the coronavirus pandemic, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

title: Staples Center in L.A. to Be Renamed Crypto.com Arena
summary: Sponsorship deal at home of Lakers and LeBron James is cryptocurrency industry's latest move to gain mainstream recognition. The Staples Center, home to LeBron James and the Los Angeles Lakers, will be renamed the Crypto.com Arena after a Singapore-based cryptocurrency brokerage paid to sponsor the sports and concert venue.

title: Wide Angles (Thursday Crossword, November 18)
Biden at the Bridge
summary: White House math on infrastructure funding foreshadows disappointing results.. When it comes to motivational speaking, President Joe Biden is no Kirby Smart. But this week Mr. Biden is gamely trying to sell his latest 13-figure spending law at a series of events in various states.

title: Treasurys Edge Toward Stability After Selloff
summary: Various market indicators suggest that most investors still expect inflation to moderate in the coming years. U.S. government bond yields are showing signs of stabilizing near the top of their 2021 range after a bout of selling precipitated by last week's surprisingly high inflation data.

title: Welcome Back to the Wild World of Inflation
summary: It is a tax of which Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren would be proud.. Are city and county budget surpluses piling up in your area? ("The Inflation Revenue Dividend," Review & Outlook, Nov. 13) Ask your local leadership to consider instituting a variable surplus property-tax credit to be applied toward the annual property-tax bill.

title: How to Honor Veterans in the Way We Fight
summary: War is a last resort, but if we go to war, commit to winning.. As a disillusioned Vietnam veteran betrayed by his president (Lyndon Johnson) and his feckless defense secretary (Robert McNamara), who sent me off to a war he had already decided couldn't be won, and as a retired military professional disgusted with our chaotic and humiliating withdrawal from Afghanistan, I thoroughly support Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster's thesis: "Honor Veterans by Having the Will to Win a War" (op-ed, Nov. 11). It is time for our government to adopt the Powell doctrine: War is a last resort, but if we go to war, commit to winning. Garner the support of the people and commit enough force to win. There is no other way to do it.

title: Don't Leave Your Employer's Assistance on the Table
summary: It's a mistake to 'take a career break' and accumulate huge debt getting an M.B.A.. With respect to "Help Really Wanted: Firms Ease Hiring" (Page One, Nov. 8) and "How Much M.B.A. Debt Should Students Take On?" (Personal Journal, Nov. 8): Is no one connecting the dots? This is the best time in decades for employers to pitch tuition assistance as their secret weapon in the recruitment process and to benefit from improved employee retention.

title: Follow Proust on the Science
summary: 'To believe in medicine would be utter madness, were it not still a greater madness not to believe in it.'. David Shaywitz's "The Dangers of Finding a Cure," reviewing "You Bet Your Life" by Paul Offit (Bookshelf, Nov. 9), reminded me of a comment by Marcel Proust. In his novel "In Search of Lost Time" (1913), Proust writes: "For, medicine being a compendium of the successive and contradictory mistakes of doctors, even when we call in the best of them the chances are that we may be staking our hopes on some medical theory that will be proved false in a few years. So that to believe in medicine would be utter madness, were it not still a greater madness not to believe in it, for from this accumulation of errors a few valid theories have emerged in the long run."

title: Democrats Offer Something for Nothing on Drug Prices
summary: Don't fall for it.. Why is it that whenever I read of some drug-price policy from the Democrats ("A Toxic Drug-Price Deal," Review & Outlook, Nov. 9), I feel as if they want to kill my grandchildren? It's always something for nothing. They never bring up the price of their policies: a stop to new drug development. God forbid, but if my grandchildren come down with some awful disease, I want there to be a cure or treatment for them.

title: In Arbery Murder Trial, Defendant Travis McMichael Takes the Stand
summary: Defendant shows emotion while telling jury about altercation with Ahmaud Arbery. Travis McMichael, one of the men accused of killing Ahmaud Arbery, took the stand in his defense Wednesday, choking up and wiping away tears as he described wrestling with Mr. Arbery and then firing at him with his shotgun.

title: Google, CME Cloud Partnership Could Upend Tech Investments by Traders
summary: High-frequency traders have spent years building systems designed to work with the exchange's data center. CME Group Inc.'s plan to move core trading systems to Google Cloud could upend hundreds of millions of dollars in investments by traders in communications and data centers, industry analysts say.

title: Britney Spears Says Her Fans Saved Her Life
summary: Pop star applauds #FreeBritney movement, says 'voice was muted and threatened for so long' after conservatorship ends. Britney Spears credited her fans for saving her life, the pop star said in her first extensive comments since she was freed from her 13-year conservatorship.

summary: The company best known for its Greek yogurt had sales of $1.21 billion for the first nine months of 2021. Chobani Inc. filed paperwork for its initial public offering, riding a wave of consumer and investor enthusiasm for socially responsible and health-conscious companies.

title: New York Life Taps Current President as Next CEO
summary: CEO Ted Mathas to step down in April. New York Life Insurance Co.'s longtime chief executive, Ted Mathas, will hand over the reins of the 176-year-old company in April to current president Craig DeSanto.

title: Just Buy the House Next Door if You Need More Space For Your Basketball Court
summary: Resume Subscription. Cheryl DeSisto spent her New Jersey childhood playing in her backyard until dark. But that was something her three children seldom did at their home in Manhattan Beach, Calif. To remedy that, Ms. DeSisto took an unusual step: In 2018, she bought the house next door for about $3.2 million, tore it down and turned the roughly 5,000-square-foot lot into an outdoor play space for her children.

title: 'QAnon Shaman' Sentenced to 41 Months in Prison Over Capitol Riot
summary: Judge imposes stiff sentence after defendant gives speech referencing Gandhi, 'Shawshank Redemption'. WASHINGTON-Jacob Chansley, the self-described "QAnon Shaman" photographed at the Jan. 6 riot wearing a Viking hat with fur and horns, was sentenced to more than three years in prison Wednesday by a federal judge who said he believed Mr. Chansley showed genuine remorse but his actions at the Capitol were too horrific to prescribe lesser punishment.

title: Lowe's Sales Rise as Retailer Shows Resilience to Inflation
summary: Home-improvement retailer notches improved profits, a sign of its ability to navigate higher costs. Lowe's Cos. on Wednesday posted higher quarterly sales, joining a group of large retailers that have extended their pandemic-era growth into autumn despite challenging supply dynamics.

summary: Commission approved rule to allow shareholders to pick candidates from multiple slates for board seats. title: Iran's Stockpile of Near-Weapons- Grade Nuclear Fuel Grows, U.N. Finds
summary: Tehran almost doubled output of highly enriched uranium in recent months, IAEA says. Iran's stockpile of near-weapons-grade nuclear fuel has jumped significantly, according to a confidential report by the United Nations atomic agency that found Tehran has almost doubled its output of highly enriched uranium in recent months, putting it closer to being able to produce the fuel needed for a nuclear weapon.

title: Truckers Steer Clear of 24-Hour Operations at Southern California Ports

summary: Profit margins are far and away the highest they have been in years. Under Europe's climate policies, this shouldn't be happening.. title: How the Fed Rigs the Bond Market
summary: Sales by 'vigilantes' used to serve as a warning of inflationary policies. The signal has been muted.. High inflation should no longer be surprising, nor should it be labeled "transitory." Its existence should prompt serious reflection on policy decisions and spur action to avoid a financial crisis.

title: Biden Has a Summit With Xi, but No Strategy for China
summary: Beijing's arms buildup and menacing of Taiwan make U.S. directionlessness dangerous for the world.. America has no China strategy 10 months after President Biden's inauguration. Monday's Zoom meeting between Mr. Biden and Xi Jinping only highlighted that void. Dulcet tones and torrents of presidential words are no substitute for clear policies. Beijing could perceive White House emphasis on "cooling tensions" as a green light to continue its assertive behavior. What explains the absence of U.S. direction? Insufficient presidential engagement? Conflicting advice? Indecision?

title: A Closer Look
summary: Selections from 'The Wonderful Wizard of Oz' by L. Frank Baum, illustrated by MinaLima. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: U.K. Inflation Hits 10-Year High, Stirring Expectations of Rate Rise
summary: Economists and investors believe the BOE could act as soon as next month to tame price growth. LONDON-Annual inflation in the U.K. accelerated to its fastest rate in a decade, strengthening expectations the Bank of England will be the first major central bank to lift interest rates from pandemic lows as worries over global inflation intensify.

title: Russia's Missile Test Adds to Space-Junk Concerns
summary: Companies navigate debris as they spend billions of dollars to develop businesses in space. Orbital debris created when a Russian missile destroyed a defunct satellite on Monday adds to a problem for the nascent space industry: navigating a growing field of space junk.

title: Environment and Climate-Focused Funds Dominate ESG Investing
summary: Funds concentrating on the 'social' and 'governance' parts trail far behind in terms of drawing investors' money this year. For funds focused on ESG (environmental, social and governance) principles, the "E" remains king as a magnet for investors.

title: Jessica Seinfeld on Being (Kinda, Sorta) Vegan
summary: The cookbook author and philanthropist explains how she convinces her kids-and her husband, Jerry Seinfeld-to eat less meat and dairy.. The cookbook author Jessica Seinfeld is standing in her office, which also happens to be her kitchen. "This is where I do my homework," she says, referring to writing her fifth book, Vegan, at Times, which comes out this month and includes more than 120 plant-based recipes. There's not a chair in sight. "I try not to sit because I heard sitting is the new smoking," she says, deadpan. "And we're sitting ourselves to death."

title: Paytm's Mega IPO Is Priced for Perfection
summary: The firm is growing fast and financial services could be a powerful new growth driver. But deep pocketed competitors and the global regulatory wave pose risks.. Chinese billionaire Jack Ma may finally cash out through the initial public offering of a mobile payments giant. Not, however, a Chinese one.

title: AI Customer-Service Startup Netomi Raises $30 Million
summary: The new round of funding values the company at $210 million, up from a valuation of $67.5 million in 2019.. Netomi Inc., a provider of customer-service chatbots, said it has raised $30 million in a Series B funding round that values the company at $210 million, up from a valuation of $67.5 million in 2019.

title: Have Airlines and Airports Done Enough to Tame Unruly Passengers?
summary: Bad behavior has increased and can have a significant impact on airline staff and travelers alike. The holiday travel season starting next week will test whether airlines, regulators and airports have done enough to combat a sharp rise in unruly passenger behavior and ease tensions for travelers.

title: Former Pittsburgh Steel Mill to Become Biomedical-Manufacturing Plant
summary: The effort is part of a decadeslong process to transition away from the region's legacy industries. The Richard King Mellon Foundation announced a $100 million grant to fund a center for biomedical manufacturing, the latest piece in a plan to redevelop a stretch of riverfront outside Pittsburgh nearly half the size of the city's downtown.

title: Peloton Can't Buy Happiness
summary: Peloton's investors cheered a cash raise Tuesday as a solution to its problems when it could signal even more of them to come. Peloton Interactive has said it "sells happiness." Too bad it can't buy its own.

title: What Happens to Service When You Raise the Minimum Wage?
summary: According to one study, after one California city raised its wage, complaints about service fell. There's a lot of debate about whether raising the minimum wage decreases employment, and whether it is a net plus or minus for businesses. But a new study suggests that higher pay is a positive for at least one group: customers.

title: Goldman CEO Calls China, Hong Kong Covid Policies a 'Headwind for Global Talent'
summary: David Solomon's comments echo calls from the expatriate business community to ease border restrictions. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. Chief Executive David Solomon said mainland China and Hong Kong's strict border controls are creating staffing challenges, as the region's tight quarantine regime wears on foreign workers and businesses.

title: Airlines Are Rewriting the Rules on Frequent-Flier Programs-Again
summary: Spending now can be more important for points and status than actual flying under some new travel-rewards programs. Frequent-flier programs really need a new name: Welcome to the era of the frequent-spender program.

title: The Ottawa Senators Are Fully Vaccinated-40% of the Team Tested Positive for Covid
summary: The sidelining of an NHL team this week shows that, while vaccination rates are high, indoor, maskless activities can still lead to an outbreak. A substantial Covid-19 outbreak that this week has sidelined the National Hockey League's Ottawa Senators-despite the entire team being vaccinated-carries a warning for the coming months of professional sports: even with blanket immunization, pandemic disruptions are far from over.

title: Carlyle to Buy Switzerland's AutoForm in $2 Billion Deal
summary: U.S. buyout firm is acquiring the business from smaller European buyout rival Astorg. U.S. private-equity firm Carlyle Group Inc. Wednesday struck a $2 billion deal to acquire AutoForm Engineering GmbH, a Switzerland-based industrial software provider.

title: U.S. Boosts Order for Glaxo's Covid-19 Antibody Drug
summary: Purchase will expand availability of a type of treatment that has proven useful in reducing hospitalizations. The U.S. government has agreed to buy more doses of an antibody drug for the early treatment of Covid-19 developed by GlaxoSmithKline PLC and Vir Biotechnology Inc., bringing its total order to nearly $1 billion for a treatment found to reduce the risk of hospitalization.

title: Biden's New Deal Ambitions Run Into Political, Economic Constraints
summary: FDR confronted economic devastation as his party had congressional majorities, unlike today's nearly evenly divided Washington. President Biden and his aides invoke liberal icons Franklin D. Roosevelt and Lyndon B. Johnson as role models for the historical impression he hopes to leave. His chief of staff, Ron Klain, late last month boasted that Mr. Biden's spending plan is "twice as big, in real dollars, as the New Deal."

title: Two Dynasties Accused of Rights Abuses Join Forces in the Philippines
summary: Sara Duterte-Carpio, daughter of the current president, opts to run as vice president rather than challenge Ferdinand Marcos Jr., son of a former dictator. SINGAPORE-Two political dynasties have joined forces in the Philippines presidential race, creating a formidable ticket in the contest and uniting two powerful families that have faced allegations of human rights abuses.

title: Suppliers Pushed to Disclose More Climate Data
summary: Finance executives say they are facing limited visibility into indirect pollution sources. Companies are pressing their suppliers to disclose data on greenhouse-gas emissions amid a struggle to more precisely account for something that's hard to quantify: their pollution.

title: One of the World's Strongest Stock Markets Is Starting to Fizzle
summary: South Korean stocks have been hit by slowing growth, rising interest rates and the prospect of lower chip prices. Challenges are piling up for South Korea's once highflying shares.

title: It Isn't Just Tesla's Stock That Needs to Slow Down
summary: Elon Musk boosters and skeptics alike might agree that the car industry's aggregate market value leaves too little room for error. Whatever your view on Tesla, pulling money out of the car industry right now makes sense.

title: Gun-Control Support Drops Amid Rising Crime
summary: A new survey by Gallup found that 52% of U.S. adults want stricter gun laws and 19% support a ban on handguns. Americans' support for stricter gun-control measures has fallen to its lowest level since 2014, according to a poll released Wednesday by Gallup.

title: Australia to Beef Up High-Tech Prowess After Security Pact With U.S.
summary: American ally says quantum science has commercial, defense uses. SYDNEY-Australia will strengthen its capabilities in quantum science and other technologies that could be used to counter threats from China, providing more detail on the type of innovations Australia might develop alongside the U.S. under a new security partnership.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.
